intro: Cerastium sonnei, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cool, moist environments. It is often found in alpine meadows and mountain pastures, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of these habitats. Cerastium sonnei is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
